--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> amitbonde1982 wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > i am new to the field of automated testing.
> > 
> > i tried the sample test given in the documents of jwebunit.
> > i compiled and run it from command prompt.
> > 
> > i think it runs successfully as it does not throw any error, but it
> > also does not indicate the results.
> > 
> > how do i collect the results?
> > 
> >    also wanted to ask about ant maven, are they necessary for
> > installing jwebunit?
> > 
> >      Please help..
> 
> This sounds very strange. Please show us the command you use to run 
> jWebUnit. Since jWebUnit is "just" an HTTP client and a bunch of 
> assertions built on top of JUnit, I can't imagine why you wouldn't get 
> test results: when running tests, it's the same as plain JUnit.
> -- 
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing


   I have tried the sample test, called "JWebUnitSearchExample" which
performs a Google search for Httpunit and validates the presence of
link, given in the documentation of jwebunit.
   I run it through command prompt with command      
"java junit.textui.TestRunner
net.sourceforge.jwebunit.sample.JWebUnitSearchExample", I am not sure
whether it runs successfuly as I dont get any messages and my firewall
alerts me about the application accessing the net. After while the
application returns to command prompt again, displayin no results nor
any errors.

   When I tried the graphical Testrunner of Junit using command 
"java junit.swingui.TestRunner
net.sourceforge.jwebunit.sample.JWebUnitSearchExample, but in the
interface I get an error 'Class not found
"net.sourceforge.jwebunit.sample.JWebUnitSearchExample"'.

Please help.

Regards,
Amit
